definitions.definition: to destroy or reduce the pleasure, interest, or beauty of something:
examples: He tried not to let the bad news spoil his evening.

definitions.definition: When food spoils or is spoiled, it is no longer good enough to eat:
examples: The dessert will spoil if you don't keep it in the fridge.

definitions.definition: to mark a ballot paper so that it cannot be officially counted as a vote:
examples: Since she supported none of the candidates, she spoiled her ballot paper.

definitions.definition: earth, stones, etc. dug out from a hole in the ground:
